CodeList.Name: Culture Medium Type

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the type of medium used to culture a specimen.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A solid growth medium mainly consisting of peptones, sodium chloride, meat extracts, and mammalian blood, which is developed for the cultivation of fastidious organisms. The blood in the formulation promotes the presence and visualization of hemolytic reactions, enabling the detection and differentiation of hemolytic bacteria.

A liquid growth medium mainly consisting of sodium dihydrogen phosphate, potassium dihydrogen phosphate, magnesium sulphate, trisodium citrate, L-asparagine and phenol red, which is developed for the culture and recovery of Mycobacteria.
A growth medium mainly consisting of malachite green, glycerol, asparagine, coagulated eggs, and mineral salts which is developed especially for the cultivation of mycobacterium.

A liquid and selective growth medium that is modified based on the Kirchner medium by the addition of a mixture of antimicrobial agents (typically polymyxin B, amphotericin B, carbenicillin, and trimethoprim) and colorless tetrazolium salt as a growth indicator, which is developed for the cultivation of mycobacterium.

A solid growth medium mainly consisting of oleic acid-albumin enrichment, glycerol, dextrose and inorganic compounds, which is developed especially for the primary and secondary cultivation of mycobacterium.

A solid and selective growth medium that is modified based on the Middlebrook 7H10 agar by the addition of four antimicrobial agents: polymyxin B, carbenicillin, amphotericin B and trimethoprim lactate.
A solid growth medium that is modified based on the Middlebrook 7H10 agar by the addition of pancreatic digest of casein.

A solid and selective growth medium that is modified based on the Middlebrook 7H11 agar by the addition of four antimicrobial agents: polymyxin B, carbenicillin, amphotericin B and trimethoprim lactate.
A liquid growth medium that is modified based on the Middlebrook 7H9 broth by the addition of bovine serum albumin, casein hydrolysate, catalase and 14C-labelled palmitic acid.
A liquid growth medium mainly consisting of albumin, glycerol, dextrose and inorganic compounds, which is developed especially for the primary and secondary cultivation of mycobacterium.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Culture Medium Type Terminology
